pageContext.claim: “If these hoodlums come around, and if the states can't handle it, we are ready, willing, and able to help as we did in Minnesota, where we stopped -- after four days, they finally called, and we did a great job with the National Guard.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump falsely takes credit for sending in the National Guard. Deploying the Guard is up to the state governors, not the president. Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz (D) already had sent the National Guard to Minneapolis earlier on May 28 when Trump called him and offered to send in the military, according to WCCO CBS Minnesota.
